intro: Vicia ramuliflora f. abbreviata, commonly known as the dwarf vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features small, trifoliate leaves and produces clusters of pea-like flowers that are usually pink or violet in color. It is native to southern Europe and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. This variety is distinguished by its shorter stature and compact growth compared to the typical form of Vicia ramuliflora.
